greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of 1<=i<n such that i*n-1 is prime.
example: For n=2, i=2 gives a prime (3), so a(2)=1.
For n=10, i=2,3,6,8,9 give primes, so a(10)=5.
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(i=1, n, isprime(i*n-1)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 17 2014
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Jul 28 2003
ext: a(2) corrected and more terms from _Michel Marcus_, Mar 17 2014
